page.title: 11BLYTH CARNIVAL
page.content: Each year in July Blyth has a carnival. Carnival day is a special day for Blyth because it helps to raise money for charities and is fun as well. Trucks come around (called floats)with people dressed up on them. People come around with buckets to collect money. After the procession everyone goes to a field, called Croft Park, where there are amusements and stalls where you can win prizes. Last year there was a display by the Red Arrows, who are an aerobatics display team. The Army also did a display and so did a B.M.X. bicycle stunt team.
